common_issues.title: Ollama Installation Failure in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues installing and using Ollama within the Pieces OS desktop application across different operating systems. This is primarily due to missing dependencies and sandbox environment restrictions in the Pieces OS snap package. The Pieces team is aware of the issue and actively working on a fix. However, as of January 28, 2025, a permanent solution has not been released. Users are advised to follow the GitHub issue for updates and potential workarounds.

related_issues.title: Ollama failed to install in pieces
related_issues.text:
Ollama failed to install in pieces
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have a deepseek-r1:32b model installed in my desktop with ollama, and then try to use pieces for using this model locally, like there's a option called On-device copilot right, when I try to click to install ollama it shows failed to install and remaining all models are blocked, can you please fix it 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User srisrihari reported an issue with Ollama failing to install.
* Pieces support bot acknowledged the issue and provided helpful resources.
* Pieces team member confirmed it's a known issue and is actively being addressed.
* The issue is duplicate of another one with a comment explaining the resolution.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation failure.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The team is actively working on resolving the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is closed as a duplicate of another one with a comment explaining the resolution.

**Outcome:**

* The Ollama installation issue is being addressed by the Pieces team.
* Users are advised to refer to the duplicate issue for further information.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## GitHub Issue Summary: Ollama Installation Issues in Pieces-OS Snap

**Key Points:**

* User `brian-at-pieces` reported an issue where Pieces-OS snap fails to install Ollama due to missing curl dependency.
* User `ekuznetsov139` identified the root cause as lack of curl access within the sandbox environment of the snap.
* `brian-at-pieces` acknowledged the issue and confirmed it was due to a miscommunication about package confinement.
* A fix was being worked on and scheduled for release in the following week (Jan 23, 2025).
* As of Jan 28, 2025, the fix was still not released due to higher priority infrastructure updates.
* User `cwoolfo1` inquired about workarounds for downloading local LLM models while the issue persists.
* `brian-at-pieces` clarified that the issue also affects inference and downloading models won't be a solution.


**Problems Identified:**

* Missing curl dependency in the snap package.
* Ollama installation failure due to sandbox environment restrictions.


**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add curl to the snap package dependencies.
* Modify the package to allow Ollama access within the sandbox.


**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix is still under development and hasn't been released as of Jan 28, 2025.
* The issue impacts both model downloading and inference.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Linux Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties with Pieces OS on Linux, including Copilot access problems, sandbox limitations preventing LTM code visibility, and Ollama installation failures due to missing dependencies and sandbox restrictions. Proposed solutions involve upgrading to Pieces OS 11.1.0, addressing sandbox permissions, and including curl in the snap package.

related_issues.title: LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser
related_issues.text: LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.4 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Copilot's LTM is unable to see the content of a sandbox (eg. [Svelte Tutorial](https://svelte.dev/tutorial/kit/handlefetch)). ## GitHub Issue Summary **Key Points:** * User @dotnetemmanuel reported an issue with Copilot not working on Linux. * The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team. * Mark from Pieces support suggested trying the upcoming 11.1.0 PiecesOS release for a potential fix. * @dotnetemmanuel agreed to test the new release and report back. **Problems Identified:** * Copilot not working on Linux. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Upgrading to PiecesOS 11.1.0 release. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is pending resolution with the upcoming PiecesOS release. @dotnetemmanuel will test and report back.

related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: false
Path:

Local Port: 39301

**Device Information**

Operating System: Linux
Current Version: Linux 6.8.0-51-generic #52-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu Dec  5 13:09:44 UTC 2024
Min Version Supported: Ubuntu 18
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @Sahil-kushwaha reported an issue with being unable to open Pieces Copilot Service.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant team member.

* User cannot access Pieces Copilot Service.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue was automatically routed to the relevant team member for investigation and resolution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user can expect a follow-up within 24 hours regarding the issue.
* The user can refer to the provided resources for additional information and support.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation is from January 28, 2025.
* The specific details of the issue and its resolution are not available in this conversation excerpt.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues on port 39300
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS on port 39300, encountering errors like "connect ECONNREFUSED" and "Route not found." This is often due to Pieces OS dynamically assigning ports within a range starting from 39300.  Solutions include checking the .port.txt file for the active port or reinstalling Pieces OS.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Raju-git20 is experiencing issues connecting to PiecesOS with the new port 39300.
* Raju-git20 is working on a Python project that connects to LinkedIn for scraping positions and applying to them using AI.

**Problems Identified:**

* Raju-git20's initial attempt to connect using port 39300 was unsuccessful.
* The exact port used by PiecesOS can vary and is updated in the com.pieces.os/production/config/.port.txt file.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mark-at-pieces clarified that POS checks a range of 100 ports starting from 39300 to find the active port.
* mark-at-pieces offered to schedule a call to discuss Raju-git20's project and provide feedback.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Raju-git20 is aware of the port-finding algorithm and will likely attempt to connect again.
* A call has been scheduled for further discussion and feedback.

### Software

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The problem "route not found" appears whenever I attempt to access the pieces os endpoint on port 39300.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4f8961a-afa1-401d-82b5-cc2ead804b9f)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Key points raised:**

* User Raju-git20 is unable to access POS and is encountering a "connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000" error.
* The user is unsure of the POS version number.

**Problems identified:**

* The user is experiencing connectivity issues with POS.
* The user needs assistance in determining the POS version number.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces support bot provides helpful resources and related issues for the user to review.
* A Pieces team member, Mark, reaches out to the user to assist with troubleshooting.
* Mark requests the user's POS version number and explains the port-finding algorithm used by POS.
* Mark suggests connecting the user with the appropriate Pieces team for further support.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is closed as it is considered a continuation of a previous issue (#597).
* Mark directs the user to the previous issue and related comment for further details.

**Additional notes:**

* The user is likely building a connected product and needs assistance integrating with POS.
* Mark offers to connect the user with the appropriate team at Pieces to assist with their development journey.

related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies  Retry Step , I need help #bug
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS  v11.0.4 and Pieces for Developers v3.3.4 

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i am trying to launch but showing same error repeatedly .
how to fix this error 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d210966-b923-4f51-81ae-b6941e3824b8)
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Launch Issue & User Feedback

**Key Points:**

* Aspirant2 reported an issue launching PiecesOS.
* Pieces-support-bot provided troubleshooting tips and resources.
* The issue was resolved by reinstalling PiecesOS via the Microsoft Store.

**Problems Identified:**

* Aspirant2 initially had trouble launching PiecesOS using the .appinstaller file.
* Aspirant2 found the response time and accuracy of PiecesOS to be subpar compared to ChatGPT.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Reinstalling PiecesOS via the Microsoft Store resolved the launch issue.
* Aspirant2 provided valuable feedback on the performance and accuracy of PiecesOS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The launch issue has been resolved.
* Aspirant2 has opted not to use PiecesOS due to its current limitations.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation highlights the importance of user feedback in driving product improvement.
* Pieces appears to be a promising concept but requires further development to compete with existing AI tools.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High RAM and CPU Usage
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS consuming excessive RAM and CPU, causing slowdowns. This issue appears related to internet connectivity and background processes. Proposed solutions include restarting PiecesOS, disabling Live Context, and upgrading to version 11.1.0, which optimizes memory and CPU usage. Users experiencing persistent issues are encouraged to contact Pieces support.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of PiecesOS RAM and CPU issues:

**Key Points Raised:**

* PiecesOS consumes high RAM, sometimes exceeding 5GB, even when not actively used.
* High CPU usage spikes to 120% or more, slowing down the system.
* Running PiecesOS in the background significantly impacts RAM and CPU performance.

**Identified Problems:**

* A memory leak with unknown cause leads to excessive RAM usage.
* High CPU usage spikes cause system slowdowns, despite no identifiable triggers.
* Using Live Context feature adds to RAM consumption due to its data processing demands.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 release replaces heavy database technologies to address memory and CPU issues.
* Option to optimize memory usage in the PiecesOS interface.
* Turning off Live Context to reduce RAM consumption.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The 11.1.0 release aims to improve CPU usage and reduce memory consumption.
* Further fixes are planned for future releases.
* Users are encouraged to update to 11.1.0 and report their experiences.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems ongoing, with reports continuing in 2025.
* RAM consumption of around 2GB is considered standard, though developers are actively working on reducing it.
* Users can schedule a call with the Pieces team to troubleshoot individual issues.

related_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies need help asap
related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies need help asap
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50ccb8d9-4bd4-4036-85f9-6f42840bec67)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ceec7f4-768a-43cc-b06d-25a14c6d4e94)

I have this issue with opening Pieces and is checking updates and it does reload many times, need help asap
## GitHub Conversation Summary

**Reported issue:** CPX10 reports an issue with the inability to update Pieces on their Windows device.

**Key points:**

* The user installed Pieces and PiecesOS from the Microsoft Store.
* The user is unable to update the applications.

**Proposed solutions:**

* Quit PiecesOS and the Desktop App, then re-open.
* Update the applications from the Microsoft Store.

**Implemented solution:**

* The user confirmed that the issue was resolved after updating the applications from the Microsoft Store.

**Current status:**

* The issue is closed.

**Future improvements:**

* The development team will work on improving the updating experience for Microsoft Store builds.

**Additional notes:**

* The user was referred to related issues and helpful resources.
* The support team responded promptly and efficiently.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS/Desktop App Launch and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS/Desktop app launch failures, often after updates. This might involve non-dismissable dialogs or repeated "Ensure core dependencies" errors. Suggested solutions include restarting the computer, ensuring only one app (OS or Desktop) launches at startup, reinstalling from the Microsoft Store, or waiting for automatic updates.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue 

**Key points raised:**

* ThemePark is experiencing issues with the Pieces Desktop app not opening after the latest Pieces OS 11.0 release.
* The issue seems to be related to a timing conflict between PiecesOS and the Desktop app trying to launch simultaneously on startup.

**Problems identified:**

* The Pieces Desktop app is not opening after the latest Pieces OS 11.0 release.
* There is a potential timing conflict between PiecesOS and the Desktop app on startup.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack, a support representative, investigated the issue and suspects it is a timing conflict.
* Mack suggests confirming that only one of the two apps (PiecesOS or Desktop) is configured to launch on startup.

**Current status/outcome:**

* ThemePark confirmed that only PiecesOS is configured to launch on startup.
* The suggested solution is yet to be implemented.

**Next steps:**

* ThemePark can try launching only PiecesOS on startup to see if the issue resolves.
* If the issue persists, further troubleshooting may be necessary.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Ollama installation issues on Pieces OS, particularly focusing on dependency conflicts and sandbox restrictions within the snap package.**

**Investigate and address the root causes of Pieces OS connection issues on port 39300, potentially by improving port assignment logic or providing clearer guidance to users on identifying the active port.**
**Provide support and documentation for Pieces OS on Linux, addressing issues like Copilot access problems, sandbox limitations, and Ollama installation failures.**
**Investigate and address reports of high RAM and CPU usage in PiecesOS, potentially optimizing background processes and resource management.**
**Improve the PiecesOS/Desktop app launch and update process, focusing on resolving issues with non-dismissable dialogs and "Ensure core dependencies" errors.**
